listing.description: 2 Bedroom ApartmentIverna Quay is situated alongside the River Thames, nestled behind Greenwich Yacht Club.A luxury 930 square foot two bedroom apartment with an open plan kitchen / living / dining area with a view of the River Thames also access to a balcony. En suite to master bedroom with fitted wardrobe. Generously sized second bedroom also including a family bathroom. Situated in an exciting community with plenty of green space and local amenities in easy reach and fantastic transport connections. Please note this is a leasehold property and subject to ground rent and service charges. Please speak to a Sales Consultant for further details. Greenwich Millennium VillageDescribed as one of the most exciting new residential neighbourhoods in Europe, Greenwich Millennium Village is a contemporary development that offers a different quality of life. Situated on Greenwich Peninsula, a short distance from the historic charm of Old Greenwich, it is just one stop on the Jubilee line from Canary Wharf and four stops from London Bridge.Greenwich Millennium Village offers 21st Century living in a peaceful green setting, just a short walk from the O2 and North Greenwich station. listing.description: A delightful four bedroom family house (circa 2367sq/ft) with high ceilings and a wealth of period features situated in a quiet turning in the heart of Primrose Hill Village. This charming property which has been stylishly renovated benefits from exceptional entertaining rooms and a self-contained apartment. The Raised Ground floor provides a stunning 37 ft kitchen breakfast room with a separate dining room and a playroom to the rear, whilst the first floor has the original drawing room spanning the entire width of the building and a separate study. The second floor comprises two double bedrooms and a family bathroom, with the principal bedroom suite occupying the entire top floor with handmade wardrobes and a feature shower room. The garden level which also benefits from its own entrance has a good size double bedroom with a luxurious en-suite shower room and a large open plan kitchen dining room with bi-folding doors leading directly out to a patio garden. Cellarage and good storage are an added bonus. The house is ideally positioned to allow easy access for the restaurants, boutiques and open green spaces of Primrose Hill and Regents Park, and is 0.4 miles from Chalk Farm Underground station.

listing.description: Located on the 16th floor of North Tower and offering triple aspect views, the luxury apartment comprises open plan bespoke kitchen/living room with integrated appliances, two double bedrooms with ensuites, further double bedroom with built in wardrobes, separate luxury bathroom and a winter garden with bespoke Crittall doors. 1475 sq ftAll apartments feature oak herringbone flooring to hallway, living room, kitchen and master bedroom, underfloor heating throughout and comfort cooling to reception rooms and bedrooms and 24 hour onsite security with CCTV monitoring. All occupants will further benefit from an array of amenities including 24 hour dedicated concierge, residents' lounge, screening room, work hub, gym, private dining room, treatment room and communal terrace.Located in London's historic Sun Street conservation area, the development is set to deliver a total of 246 private apartments distributed amongst two towers, a boutique hotel, 140,000 sq ft of premium office space, retail units totalling 7,000 sq ft, and a historic Georgian terrace that will be fully restored as part of the scheme.One Crown Place is centrally located and is within 3 minutes' walk from Liverpool Street station with Shoreditch and Old Street a short walk away. The rest of London, from the West End to Canary Wharf is easily accessed by tube and there are quick connections to all London airports. Furthermore, Crossrail services are scheduled to begin at Liverpool Street Station in 2018 creating a faster and more efficient route for travelling both east and west.Walking times:Liverpool Street Station - 3 minutesMoorgate Station - 5 minutesOld Street Station - 8 minutesShoreditch High Street Station - 12 minutesBank Station - 13 minutesTravel times:London Bridge - 7 minutesKing's Cross St Pancras - 8 minutesOxford Circus - 10 minutesVictoria - 14 minutesTottenham Court Road - 4 minutes (Elizabeth Line)Canary Wharf - 6 minutes (Elizabeth Line)Paddington - 10 minutes (Elizabeth Line)Heathrow Airport - 35 minutes (Elizabeth Line)Gatwick Airport - 40 minutesAnticipated completion 2020Computer generated imaged for indicative purposes only

listing.description: This charming one bedroom conversion features; large sash windows, lovely high ceilings and a neutral finish throughout, creating a beautifully light & airy home.An ideal first-time buy, this first floor flat comprises; large master bedroom with views across the rear gardens, a well finished bathroom suite, and a sweet open-plan kitchen-reception room with large south-facing sash windows.Cazenove Road is ideally located for short walks onto Stokey High Street and the eclectic mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants on Church Street. Links into the City and Central London are quick and easy, with Stoke Newington station (literally) just around the corner. Peaceful Abney Park Cemetery and Clissold Park are both within easy reach, too.

listing.description: Tepilo are proud to present this splendid example of a 1930???s semi-detached family home situated within the extremely desirable Upper Walthamstow area. Set in an idyllic tree lined road, this already spacious three bedroom property with detached garage, double glazing and an open plan lounge/diner, further benefits from being offered to the market complete with approved Planning Permission for a Single Storey Rear Extension for fully open-plan, family friendly living. Depending on which direction you take, this wonderful home is within just a five minute walk to Wood Street Mainline Station, an ???Outstanding??? Ofsted rated Primary School, a highly sought after Independent School (4-18yrs) and Hollow Ponds Boating Lake. There is also excellent access to Snaresbrook Central Line Station, the A406 & the M11, and many good Secondary Schools making it the perfect location for the ever changing needs of a modern family. With all of this on the doorstep, this home is in the unique and enviable position of being situated in a quiet cul-de-sac, complete with its very own warm and special sense of community.Porch:Double glazed double doors, lit porch entrance (with power supply).Hallway:Spacious entrance hall providing access to staircase, lounge/diner and kitchen. The large understairs area currently houses a tall fridge/freezer.Kitchen (2.75m x 2.09m / 9'0" x 6'10"):Plumbed in for Washing Machine/Dishwasher, Gas Cooker, Low and High based cupboard, Single Mixer Sink Unit. Leads out to the conservatory.Through lounge/dining room (8.88m x 3.86m / 29'2" x 12'8"):A large through lounge/dining room with large double-glazed bay window providing lots of natural light. The property features a landscaped rear garden of approx 100ft providing scope for further extensions (s.T.P.P)., and is positioned in a sought after and quiet residential side road conveniently positioned for 'The Croft' open space plus excellent local schools.EPC - EInternalThe accommodation comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with modern cloakroom, front aspect sitting room with connecting doors to the contemporary style extended kitchen/breakfast room with under floor heating plus further access to the dining/family room (each with double doors leading to the attractive rear garden). The staircase rises from the hallway to the first floor landing giving access to the two main bedrooms with modern fitted wardrobes plus a good sized third bedroom and large modern bathroom with four piece suite and under floor heating.ExternalThe front garden is laid to lawn and features a block paved own driveway providing off road parking leading to the attached garage. The attractively landscaped rear garden which extends to approximately 100ft features a sculptured lawn area with flower bed borders, patio, and a timber built garden room measuring 15'9 x 9'2 with power and light. There are also external power points to both front and rear gardens.

listing.description: Set within a brand new development with concierge and video entry, this luxurious second floor studio flat offers a well proportioned open-plan living space with an exceptionally high finish and designer kitchen. It is one of the largest studios in the development coming in at almost 500 square feet.As one of Londons largest boroughs, Hounslow is home to four bustling town centres including Chiswick, Brentford and Feltham, offering a wealth of choice for shopping, dining, leisure and entertainment opportunities. The Blenheim Centre is just a 10 minute walk away and includes a gym and supermarket, whilst The Treaty Centre on Hounslow High Street, only six minutes away, features over 40 fashion and food outlets for leisure seekers and fashion addicts to explore.Residents at Trinity Square can enjoy a convenient seven minute walk to Hounslow Central, Piccadilly line services (Zone 4), offering a journey time of just 10 minutes to Heathrow Airport and 49 minutes to Kings Cross St. Pancras for access to Eurostar services. Meanwhile, Hounslow Overground station is just 12 minutes away by foot and takes you directly to London Waterloo within 40 minutes.

listing.description: A beautifully presented Victorian double fronted detached family home in the heart of Poets Corner with an abundance of original charm and character. To the ground floor the double fronted house has two distinct reception rooms with a separate formal dining room, a modern conservatory opening up on to a large garden, a separate utility area and off street parking. The home is arranged over three floors with four double bedrooms, a family bathroom and en-suite on the first and a recent extension in to the loft space to provide a spacious master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom and walk in wardrobe on the third floor. To the rear, the garden is beautifully landscaped with lawn, numerous fruit trees and shrubs, a separate allotment area and a wooden outbuilding/studio space with electricity.Goldsmith Road is one of Acton's most desirable locations with Acton Central (Overground) moments away and Acton Main Line (Crossrail from 2018) approximately half a mile. There are nearby bus links to Chiswick High Road and Acton's Shopping Centre.

listing.description: A fantastic four double bedroom semi-detached family house offering almost 2,000 sq ft of living space over three floors, as well as a secluded garden and off street parking. The house is situated in a quiet 'mews' development and also has no onward chain.On the ground floor there is a superbly appointed kitchen/breakfast room which has been recently refitted by the current owners, having the latest Siemens appliances. At the rear of the house there is an elegant reception room which leads through to a dining room, providing excellent entertaining space. There is also a useful conservatory extension with views over the rear gardens, and there is also a ground floor cloakroom.On the first floor, there are two very large double bedrooms both with fitted wardrobes and shelving, each also have an en-suite bathroom. On the top floor there are two more generous double bedrooms and a large shower room.Externally there is covered off-street parking to the front of the house and at the rear there is a delightful and secluded rear garden which has a large lawned area and a patio to the house itself.Blenheim Place is situated just off Teddington Park, and is less than half a mile walk from Teddington mainline station with the boutique shops and restaurants of the High Street even closer to hand.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or ??420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee ??? From ??440 (Inc. VAT)???

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent ??? To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance ??? 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit ??? Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds ??125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - ??420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of ??54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - ??75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - ??90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - ??150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - ??30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

??? Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: St. James's Avenue is a highly desirable, quiet tree-lined residential street. This imposing detached Edwardian residence is set in a prime position screened by a mature wall and hedge and occupies a particularly large plot with a delightful 145' sunny, westerly aspect lawned rear garden. Internally the house provides extensive, well-planned and beautifully presented family accommodation of 5,037 . Arranged over three floors. A feature of the property is the exceptional and striking living space including a huge kitchen/breakfast room overlooking the superb garden, created by means of a sympathetic extension to the ground floor which includes a sunken spiral wine cellar. Further benefits include generous driveway parking and a garage with a useful mezzanine above, offering adaptable games room/office or additional bedroom space. This is one of the largest and most complete family homes we have had the pleasure to market in the area and would highly recommend a viewing to fully appreciate its many qualities.SituationSt. James's Avenue is one of Hampton Hill's most popular locations and is conveniently located for Hampton Hill High Street with its choice of restaurants, shops and cafes. Hampton is renowned for its educational facilities; both state and private, while nearby recreational pursuits include the River Thames, Hampton Court Palace and Bushy Park is within a few hundred metres.
listing.short_description: A handsome Edwardian detached house with a superb 145ft garden, garage and off street parking for several cars, quietly located in one of Hampton Hill's most desirable residential streets.

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent ??? To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance ??? 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit ??? Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds ??125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - ??420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of ??54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - ??75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - ??90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - ??150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - ??30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

??? Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: A handsome period cottage set just a short walk from the hive of life that is Sutton town centre and high street. With parks, restaurants, a cinema, fitness centres and a mainline train station on your door step, what s not to love? Complete with off street parking and front and back garden, we urge you to view as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.This house provides exceptional value for money; amazingly this freehold house is offered for sale against flats in the surrounding area. Located in a quiet tree lined side road of other similar houses, the handsome exterior fits in well with its surrounds.Once inside it is clear that the house has character and charm to add to its appeal. The large cosy reception room to the front of the house feels like a retreat, whilst the rear reception room flows into the modern spacious extended kitchen creating a large family room attracting all comers throughout the day.The kitchen will create envy within your friends and family. The first floor consists of two double bedrooms and the family bathroom. Perfectly balanced, the house feels grown up without removing the fun or entertaining side of the property. It is spacious as is, but if you are the creative sort it is also possible to consider further extension (stpp) if you require additional bedrooms. A special house which is well worth your attention.The rear garden is a place in which to tinker, relax and unwind without it requiring hours of work. Relatively private, invite friends round and spark up the bbq. The top half of the land has two parking spaces accessed from the rear.Locally, the high street is considered to be within a short walk. Additionally, the local park is moments away and large (perfect if you have a dog). Local schools include Sutton Grammar and St Philomena s. For the London commute, Sutton train station allows access into London Bridge and London Victoria with buses running to Morden and Tooting for extra lines and the tube.Fine and Country welcome your interest. If you would like to view please call now.Sitting RoomKitchen / Dining RoomStairs To First FloorBedroomEn-Suite BathroomBedroom (2nd)GardenImportant note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./1

listing.description: This lovely Victorian home is set on the premier road in Streatham, offering five bedroom over three floors. On the ground floor there is a double reception room with working fireplace and an an open plan fully fitted kitchen with space for a table and side door to the garden. Upstairs, all five bedrooms are doubles with two bathrooms; the bathroom at the top of the house has an additional luxury Jacuzzi. Outside, the lovely sunny garden has three tiers; a decked area to entertain guests, a grass area and an area laid to stone at the rear with a garden shed.Lewin Road is located in the heart of Streatham and is considered locally as one other premier roads in the area with Streatham Common across the road housing a secured children's play area (due to have extensive renovations this year), a paddling pool, and a caf??. The Common also has a beautiful Rookery to enjoy along with a wooded area, perfect for children and dogs. Lewin Road is also in the unique position of having an 'Outstanding' nursery on the road. Streatham is well serviced with excellent nurseries and schools. The property is also within close proximity to Streatham High Road offering a wealth of independently owned shops and cafe's, restaurants, pubs, and a variety of high branded supermarkets.Transport in Streatham is excellent with three stations (Streatham Hill, Streatham and Streatham Common) offering services to London Bridge, The City, and London Victoria along with other stations in West London. Streatham also has an extensive bus network allowing residence to reach locations across Central London. This is a must see property, please call us today to book a viewing.
listing.short_description: A fantastic Victorian mid terraced house offering five bedrooms, two bathrooms and off street parking set on a premier road in Streatham

listing.description: On the top floor of the hip 1930's De Havilland Studios, a superb one bedroom live/work Clapton loft with terrace and secured parking space.This is classic top floor loft living, with over 1000 sqft of open-plan space, with 12ft high ceilings, masses of light from an entire wall of windows, a good size double bedroom and access to a private roof terrace.De Havilland Studios is a glorious conversion of the former aircraft manufacturer's warehouse in the emerging Clapton area of East London, offering a collection of super cool open-plan loft apartments. There is secured parking and transport links at Clapton rail station into Liverpool Street. There are many buses that take you to nearby Hackney and Stoke Newington.As the creatives move further east, so places like Clapton become more and more popular. And Clapton really is the place right now, rivalling Peckham for its swift influx of cool bars, boozers and independent restaurants. One really can be extremely well fed and watered in this once overlooked neighbourhood - it is happening now!Leasehold: 106 years remainingService Charge: Approx. ??2750 p.A.

listing.description: The London Broker is proud to bring to market this fantastic three bedroom family home. A grass area with stone steps leads up the doors of this delightful end of terraced home. On entering the porch, you will find a WC to the left before the room opens up to give you a very large and bright open plan reception room with sliding doors to the garden. A large brick surround gas fireplace takes centre stage, currently capped. At the front of this open plan room is a kitchen in need of some modernisation. Upstairs, the property benefits from two very large bedrooms, both with cupboard space, along with a third double bedroom. There is also a family bathroom. This 1980s house is extremely versatile with the front bedroom easily able to be converted into two bedrooms, if more rooms were required. In addition, being end of terraced there is a possibility to extend to the side as well as into the roof; subject to necessary planning conditions.Outside, there is a large and open garden mainly laid to lawn. Nearest to the house are some slabs which continue to the side of the house where there is a shed and side access to the garden. The garden has herbaceous boarders with two mature silver birch's, amongst other plants. To the front of the property there is unreserved off street parking for The Close. The property is in need of some modernisation throughout.Prescott Close is located in Streatham and is well situated for many local amenities to include supermarkets, shops and a bistro-style pub. Across the road is Streatham Common, offering a large open grassed area with a secured children's play area, a paddling pool, and a caf??. The Common also has a beautiful Rookery to enjoy along with a wooded area, perfect for children and dogs. The area has an array of nurseries and schools, many of which offer 'Outstanding' status. The property is situated off Streatham High Road which has a wealth of independently owned shops and cafe's, restaurants, and pubs.Transport in Streatham is excellent with three stations (Streatham Hill, Streatham and Streatham Common) offering services to London Bridge, The City, and London Victoria along with other stations in West London. Streatham also has an extensive bus network allowing residence to reach locations across Central London. This is a must see property, please call us today to book a viewing.

listing.letting_fees:
Tenants Charges
If you choose to apply for a rented property through Stonebridge, in addition to the rent, prior to the commencement of the tenancy you will be required to pay the following:

1. Tenancy Agreement Fee: ??400
2. Referencing Fee: ??30 per person applying for the tenancy and for each guarantor who may be required.
3. Renewal of Tenancy Fee: If you decide to renew your tenancy agreement after the initial term, there will be a further charge of ??70 for the
preparation of the tenant's renewal documentation.

4. Security Deposit: All rental properties require a deposit to be taken and held as security throughout the term of the tenancy. It is registered
and protected under the Tenant's Deposit Scheme and returned to you after the end of the tenancy, less any agreed deductions. Your
deposit is usually equivalent to six week's rent.

5. You will also need to pay for the inventory check-in/out (depending on what is agreed) and the cost of this will depend on the size of the
property. At the end of the tenancy, you will also be responsible for paying for a professional clean.

6. Please speak to your local office should you require further information on these charges.

Initial Payment

Rent is payable in advance, usually monthly or quarterly.
When you apply for a tenancy of a property, you will be required to make a Payment of Intent which is usually the equivalent to one week's rent. This Payment of Intent will be offset against the total of initial monies required before the commencement of tenancy.
The payment formalises your intent to proceed with an application for a tenancy, subject to contract, though it is refundable should you decide not to proceed with the tenancy. However, if you decide not to proceed, then all of the charges and fees listed above will be deducted plus an administration fee of ??50. Should the landlord withdraw for any reason other than inadequate references, then the Payment of Intent will be refunded in full. Should the reason be for inadequate references, then the Payment of Intent will be refunded less the referencing charges as detailed above and an administration fee of ??50.
listing.description: Stonebridge has the opportunity, to present to the market this remarkable spacious three bedroom 1930's style terraced house situated in the popular North Ilford.The house will be a fantastic home for any growing family and you could mould it and turn it into your dream home. There is a lovely front garden and a low maintenance spacious rear garden. The rear garden has a garage that has direct access from the side. On the ground floor there are two good sized receptions for all the family to congregate in. The kitchen is large enough to cook and dine in.On the first floor there are three double bedrooms as well as a generous family bathroom. The property has enough room to add a loft conversion where you can create a fourth and fifth bedroom (subject to planning permission). You need to view this house internally to appreciate its size and layout. There is a lot of opportunity to add even more value to this house. It will for the right price be sold with no onward chain.HallwayReception One 15' 8" to bay x 14' 7" to alcove (4.78m x 4.44m)Reception Two 5' 2" x 11' 4" to alcove (4.62m x 3.45m)Kitchen 12' x 9' 8" (3.66m x 2.95m)First FloorBathroom/WCBedroom One 15' 11" to bay x 11' 9" (4.85m x 3.58m)Bedroom Two 12' 4" x 12' 1" (3.76m x 3.68m)Bedroom Three 8' 2" x 9' 5" (2.49m x 2.87m)Rear GardenDetached Garage17' 6" x 8' 4" (5.33m x 2.54m)Sale by TenderPlease be aware that upon purchasing a Sale by Tender property, you will incur a fee to Stonebridge in addition to the agreed purchase price.
